recipe_card: Middle Eastern Rice with Black Beans and Chickpeas 573 Ratings
recipe_name: Middle Eastern Rice with Black Beans and Chickpeas
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup uncooked basmati rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons ground coriander"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground turmeric"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 quart chicken stock"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ pounds ground turkey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (15 ounce) cans garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch chopped fresh parsley (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup pine nuts (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and ground black pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in garlic; cook for 1 minute. Stir in rice, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. Cook and stir for 5 minutes, then pour in stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, place ground turkey in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until crumbly and evenly browned."},{"recipe_directions":"Gently stir turkey, garbanzo beans, black beans, cilantro, parsley, and pine nuts into cooked rice. Season with salt and black pepper."}]

recipe_card: Simple Fried Morel Mushrooms 19 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound fresh morel mushrooms - dirt gently brushed off and mushrooms halved lengthwise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup vegetable shortening"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place halved morel mushrooms in a large bowl; cover with cold, lightly salted water. Refrigerate mushrooms for about 5 minutes to loosen any dirt; pour off salted water, rinse, and repeat twice more. Crevices of the mushrooms may harbor tiny stones or even insects. Thoroughly rinse mushrooms a final time and allow to drain on paper towels."},{"recipe_directions":"Place flour in a shallow bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat vegetable shortening in a large skillet until very hot."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll mushrooms in flour and tap off excess; gently lay mushrooms in the hot shortening."},{"recipe_directions":"Pan-fry until golden brown and flour coating is crisp, 5 to 8 minutes, turning often. Drain morels on paper towels, salt to taste, and enjoy your treasures!"}]

recipe_card: Onigiri (Japanese Rice Balls) 56 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups uncooked short-grain white rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 ½ cups water, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup bonito shavings (dry fish flakes)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 sheets nori (dry seaweed), cut into 1/2-inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons sesame seeds"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Wash rice in a mesh strainer until water runs clear. Combine washed rice and 4 1/2 cups water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low; cover, and simmer rice until water is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Let rice rest for 15 minutes to continue to steam and become tender. Allow cooked rice to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine remaining 1 cup water with salt in a small bowl; use to dampen hands before handling rice. Divide cooked rice into 8 equal portions. Use one portion of rice for each onigiri."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Divide one portion of rice in two. Create a dimple in rice and fill with a heaping teaspoon of bonito flakes. Cover with remaining portion of rice and press lightly to enclose filling inside rice ball. Gently press rice to shape into a triangle; wrap with a strip of nori and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Repeat with remaining portions of rice."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"}]

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ cup olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried basil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried marjoram"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried dill weed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried thyme"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried oregano"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried parsley"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large potatoes, peeled and cubed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine oil, garlic, basil, marjoram, dill, thyme, oregano, parsley, pepper flakes, and salt in a large bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in potatoes until evenly coated. Place potatoes in a single layer on a roasting pan or baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Roast in the preheated oven, turning occasionally to brown on all sides, until tender, about 20 to 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Serve hot and enjoy!"},{"recipe_directions":"DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS"}]

recipe_card: Quick and Easy Refried Beans 347 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons canola oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  garlic cloves, peeled"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon chili powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  lime, juiced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat canola oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook garlic cloves in hot oil, turning once, until brown on both sides, 4 to 5 minutes. Smash garlic cloves in the skillet with a fork."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir pinto beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt into mashed garlic and cook until beans are thoroughly heated, about 5 minutes. Stir occasionally."},{"recipe_directions":"Smash bean mixture with a potato masher to desired texture. Squeeze lime juice over smashed beans and stir until combined."}]

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 pounds small red new potatoes, halved"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt and freshly ground black pepper"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and adjust the oven rack to the lowest position."},{"recipe_directions":"Toss potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Arrange, cut-side down, on a rimmed cookie sheet or jellyroll pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Roast potatoes in the preheated oven until tender and golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish."}]

recipe_card: Easy Roasted Broccoli 155 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"14 ounces broccoli"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and ground black pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut broccoli florets from the stalk. Peel the stalk and slice into 1/4-inch slices. Mix florets and stem pieces with olive oil in a bowl and transfer to a baking sheet; season with salt and pepper."},{"recipe_directions":"Roast in the preheated oven until broccoli is tender and lightly browned, about 18 to 20 minutes."}]
